name: Ekphrasis: a game about looking at things
name_original: Ekphrasis: a game about looking at things
description:
This is a game about going to the museum to get away for a bit and to think about feelings you like to feel.

This was made as part of the School of Machines, Making & Make-Believe's course on making personal games.

References

The game uses text from Steve Mitchell's translation of Rainer Maria Rilke's "Archaic Torso of Apollo."

You can read more about the poem, and check out several other English-language translations in this article.

Featured artworks:

Marble torso of the so-called Apollo Lykeios

Virgin and Child

Ugolino and His Sons

The Little Fourteen-Year-Old Dancer

Perseus with the Head of Medusa

Marble statue of a lion

Bronze lamp
